alert.note: Alert for Union (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 11:52AM EST until January 16 at 11:48PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Indiana...Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, and Shawneetown. .Heavy rainfall and recent snow melt led to the current flooding on the Ohio River. Water levels are forecast to drop below flood stage at points along the river this weekend to early next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 39.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon and continue falling. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
